Package com.iceybones.scheduler.controllers

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iceybones.scheduler.controllers.Database
  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs all interactions between the application and the MySql database. NOTE: All methods in this class are single threaded.

    • Method Detail

      • getConnection

        private static java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets the active connection to the database. If the current connection is no longer valid establish a new one.
        Returns:
        the active connection to the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached

      • rollback

        public static void rollback()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs an SQL rollback operation on the database. This reverts all transactions since the last explicit or implicit commit. Automatically syncs the cached customer and appointment lists with the database after the rollback.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached

      • commit

        static void commit()
            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs an SQL commit operation on the database. This finalizes any pending transactions.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached

      • login

        static void login​(java.lang.String userName,
                  java.lang.String password)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Connects to the database and authenticates the provided login credentials. If login fails the database connection is closed and an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        userName - the name entered by the user attempting to connect
        password - the password entered by the user attempting to connect
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the userName or password provided do not match a valid database record
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached or input is invalid

      • getConnectedUser

        public static User getConnectedUser()
        Returns the user object representing the user that has successfully logged into the database. This object contains only the user's name and ID.
        Returns:
        the current user

      • cacheUsers

        private static void cacheUsers()
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs a database query to retrieve all users and updates the users field with the result.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached

      • getUsers

        static java.util.List<User> getUsers()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the cached list of users. If the users list is empty an attempt is made to re-cache and return the list.
        Returns:
        the list of users
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • getUser

        static User getUser​(int id)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the user object matching the provided id if it exists in the users list. If the users list is empty an attempt is made to re-cache the list.
        Parameters:
        id - the user's ID number
        Returns:
        the user matching the provided id
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • cacheContacts

                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs a database query to retrieve all contacts and updates the contacts field with the result.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached

      • getContacts

                                    throws java.sql.SQLException

        Returns:
        the list of contacts
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • getContact

        static Contact getContact​(int id)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the contact object matching the provided id if it exists in the contacts list. If the contacts list is empty an attempt is made to re-cache the list.
        Parameters:
        id - the contact's ID number
        Returns:
        the contact matching the provided id
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • cacheDivisions

                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs a database query to retrieve all divisions and updates the divisions field with the result.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached

      • getDivision

        static Division getDivision​(int id)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the division object matching the provided id if it exists in the division list. If the divisions list is empty an attempt is made to re-cache the list.
        Parameters:
        id - the division's ID number
        Returns:
        the division matching the provided id
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • getDivisionsByCountry

        static java.util.List<Division> getDivisionsByCountry​(Country country)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns a list of division objects matching the provided country that exist in the division list. If the divisions list is empty an attempt is made to re-cache the list.
        Parameters:
        country - the country that will be matched against
        Returns:
        a list of the divisions matching the provided country
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • getCountries

        static java.util.List<Country> getCountries()
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the cached list of countries. If the countries list is empty an attempt is made to re-cache and return the list.
        Returns:
        the list of countries
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • cacheCustomers

        private static void cacheCustomers()
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs a database query to retrieve all customers and updates the customers field with the result.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached

      • getCustomer

        static Customer getCustomer​(int id)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the customer object matching the provided id if it exists in the customers list. If the customers list is empty an attempt is made to re-cache the list.
        Parameters:
        id - the customer's ID number
        Returns:
        the customer matching the provided id
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • getCustomers

        static java.util.List<Customer> getCustomers()
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the cached list of customers. If the customers list is empty an attempt is made to re-cache and return the list.
        Returns:
        the list of customers
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • insertCustomer

        static int insertCustomer​(Customer customer)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts a new customer record into the database and returns the customerId generated by the database. A commit is performed on the database before submitting the INSERT request and the customers list is subsequently updated to include the new customer.
        Parameters:
        customer - the customer to be inserted into the database
        Returns:
        the customerId generated by the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached or data contained in the customer object does not comply with the parameters set within the database. For example, a name field being more characters than the database is set to allow.

      • updateCustomer

        static void updateCustomer​(Customer customer)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates a customer record in the database. A commit is performed on the database before submitting the UPDATE request and the corresponding customer in customers list is updated.
        Parameters:
        customer - the customer to be inserted into the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached or data contained in the customer object does not comply with the parameters set within the database. For example, a name field being more characters than the database is set to allow.

      • deleteCustomer

        static void deleteCustomer​(Customer customer)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Removes a customer record from the database. A commit is performed on the database before submitting the DELETE request and the customers list is subsequently updated to reflect the removal of the customer.
        Parameters:
        customer - the customer to be deleted from the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached.

      • cacheAppointments

        private static void cacheAppointments()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs a database query to retrieve all appointments and updates the appointments field with the result.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached

      • getAppointments

        static java.util.List<Appointment> getAppointments()
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the cached list of appointments. If the appointments list is empty an attempt is made to re-cache and return the list.
        Returns:
        the list of appointments
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached while attempting to re-cache

      • insertAppointment

        static int insertAppointment​(Appointment appointment)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts a new appointment record into the database and returns the appointmentId generated by the database. A commit is performed on the database before submitting the insert request and the appointment list is subsequently updated to include the new appointment.
        Parameters:
        appointment - the appointment to be inserted into the database
        Returns:
        the appointmentId generated by the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached or data contained in the appointment object does not comply with the parameters set within the database. For example, a title field being more characters than the database is set to allow.

      • updateAppointment

        static void updateAppointment​(Appointment appointment)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates an appointment in the database. A commit is performed on the database before submitting the UPDATE request and the corresponding appointment in appointments list is updated.
        Parameters:
        appointment - the appointment to be inserted into the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached or data contained in the appointment object does not comply with the parameters set within the database. For example, a title field being more characters than the database is set to allow.

      • deleteAppointment

        static void deleteAppointment​(Appointment appointment)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Removes an appointment from the database. A commit is performed on the database before submitting the DELETE request and the appointment list is subsequently updated to reflect the removal of the appointment.
        Parameters:
        appointment - the appointment to be deleted from the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database cannot be reached.
